criticalViolations: Legacy lib/ modules bypass traced-error system

cloudFunctions.grade: B+ (would be A with Golden Rule violations fixed)

supportingLibraries.grade: Well-structured with critical security fixes needed

criticalIssues.issue: Insecure Direct Object Modification of Feedback Items
criticalIssues.impact: The FeedbackManager component performs all status updates and deletions by writing directly to the Firestore `feedback` collection from the client. An attacker who bypasses client-side navigation controls could arbitrarily modify or delete any user-submitted feedback.

criticalIssues.issue: Denial of Wallet via Unbounded Admin-Triggered Read Operations
criticalIssues.impact: The Consistency Checker component's `runChecks` function fetches multiple entire Firestore collections. A malicious or careless administrator could repeatedly trigger this check, causing a massive number of document reads and incurring potentially unbounded costs.

criticalIssues.issue: Stored XSS via Unescaped Team Name in Audit Log Viewer
criticalIssues.impact: An attacker can set their team name to a malicious JavaScript payload. When an administrator views the audit log, the script will execute in their browser, leading to session hijacking.

criticalIssues.issue: Authorization Bypass by Disabling Global Audit Logging
criticalIssues.impact: An attacker who bypasses client-side navigation controls could call the underlying `updateAuditSettings` function from their browser console to disable all audit logging system-wide, effectively blinding the application to further malicious activity.

criticalIssues.issue: Stored XSS Vulnerability in Attack Monitor Details
criticalIssues.impact: If an attacker can inject malicious HTML into the attack_alerts collection, they could execute scripts in an admin's browser, leading to session hijacking.

criticalIssues.issue: Auth state race condition between onAuthStateChanged and Firestore snapshot
criticalIssues.impact: Components checking firebaseUser but not isUserLoading could expose authenticated routes before user profile loads

criticalIssues.issue: PIN reset timing attack enables email enumeration
criticalIssues.impact: Timing difference between 'user not found' (fast) and 'user found' (slow) allows attackers to determine valid emails

criticalIssues.issue: Insufficient authorization for predictions - no team ownership check
criticalIssues.impact: Attacker could submit predictions for another user's secondary team

criticalIssues.issue: Private league invite codes displayed in plaintext without access control
criticalIssues.impact: Compromised admin account could join all private leagues

criticalIssues.issue: Cloud Functions hardcode error codes, bypassing error registry
criticalIssues.impact: Violates Golden Rule #7, creates maintenance risk, error definitions can drift from registry

criticalIssues.issue: API key authentication is optional and uses weak header checking
criticalIssues.impact: If WORKER_API_KEY is not set, anyone can trigger queue processing

criticalIssues.issue: No authentication on health, status, QR, and ping endpoints
criticalIssues.impact: /qr endpoint exposes authentication QR codes to anyone. Potential session hijacking

criticalIssues.issue: Missing validation of Azure Storage connection string
criticalIssues.impact: Application crashes on startup with credentials exposed in error logs

criticalIssues.issue: Service account credentials loaded from environment variable without validation
criticalIssues.impact: Invalid JSON causes startup crash with potentially exposed partial credentials

criticalIssues.issue: HTML injection vulnerability in email templates
criticalIssues.impact: User-controlled data directly interpolated into HTML without sanitization. XSS attacks possible

criticalIssues.issue: Unvalidated URL construction for verification links
criticalIssues.impact: URL injection if UID contains special characters

criticalIssues.issue: Credential exposure in error messages
criticalIssues.impact: Azure AD errors could contain partial credential info in logs

criticalIssues.issue: Unescaped user-generated content in hot news HTML email
criticalIssues.impact: Admin-generated content could include malicious HTML. Broadcast to all users

criticalIssues.issue: Multiple XSS vectors in results email template
criticalIssues.impact: XSS via crafted team/race/driver names in results emails sent to all users

criticalIssues.issue: Service account private key exposed in repository
criticalIssues.impact: Anyone with repo access can bypass all Firestore security, export/modify/delete data

criticalIssues.issue: Golden Rule #7 Violation - Hardcoded error code PX-7002 at line 267
criticalIssues.impact: Error bypasses centralized registry. Cannot benefit from TracedError metadata

criticalIssues.issue: Golden Rule #7 Violation - Hardcoded error code PX-7002 at line 422
criticalIssues.impact: manualBackup returns plain string instead of TracedError with diagnostics

criticalIssues.issue: Golden Rule #7 Violation - Hardcoded error code PX-7008 at line 620
criticalIssues.impact: Error code does NOT exist in error-registry.ts, only in legacy error-codes.ts

criticalIssues.issue: Golden Rule #7 Violation - Hardcoded error code PX-7004 at line 962
criticalIssues.impact: manualSmokeTest bypasses ERRORS.BACKUP_SMOKE_TEST_FAILED definition

criticalIssues.issue: Predictions can be modified after race start

criticalIssues.issue: Missing collection protection for secondary_email_verification_tokens

criticalIssues.issue: League invite codes are publicly readable

criticalIssues.issue: Weak randomness in invite code generation

criticalIssues.issue: Weak randomness in correlation ID generation

criticalIssues.issue: Golden Rule #7 violation - Non-registry error in audit.ts

criticalIssues.issue: Service account private key exposed in repository (duplicate of BACKUP-001)
